page.title: 08RODNEY STOKE VILLAGE
page.content: Not all of the village lies within the survey block but the linear settlement built along the A371 contains some interesting variations. The main road is narrow and particularly busy in the summer tourist season and many of the houses open straight on to this road. It is difficult to walk in safety along the road because there are blind corners. Most housing is old ,several buildings dating back to the eighteenth century at least in part . Old farm houses, such as Newell Farm, Manor Farm and Holly Farm dominate and are made of natural dolomitic conflomerate and some limestone. In filling in recent years for example in Stoke Street, contrasts strongly with imitation stone commonly used, whilst Smiths Close is a good example of a twentieth century council house terrace, built in red brick.
